item.title: Linearity of Riemann(-Stieltjes) Iintegral
item.description: Summary1 This article is based on the Riemann-Stieltjes integral. If set to $\alpha=\alpha (x)=x$, it is the same as the Riemann integral. Let’s say $f$ is integrable by Riemann(-Stieltjes) from $[a,b]$. Then, for a constant $c\in \mathbb{R}$, $cf$ is also integrable from $[a,b]$, and its value is as follows. $$ \int_{a}^{b}cf d\alpha = c\int_{a}^{b}f d\alpha $$ Let two functions $f_{1}$, $f_{2}$ be integrable by Riemann(-Stieltjes) from $[a,b]$. Then, $f_{1}+f_{2}$ is
